subtitle: Tacos are the easiest of Mexican foods to prepare. This chicken and ginger filling makes a good alternative to traditional minced beef.

method.text: Melt the butter in a suitable casserole dish for 1-2 min on 100% FULL power. Add the almonds and garlic and cook for 2 min until the almonds are browned.
Toss the chicken in the taco seasoning. Stir the seasoned chicken into the almonds. Cover and cook on 100% FULL power for 4 min, stirring once.
Add the hot water to the casserole with the crystallised ginger and the coriander. Cover the dish and cook on the low rack on combination 180°C MEDIUM/LOW power for 15 min.
Remove the lid from the casserole and cook the filling for 5 min on 100% FULL power to reduce and thicken the sauce. Cover the dish and set aside.
Place the taco shells on their open sides on a suitable plate or shallow dish. Heat for 3-4 min on the low rack on combination 200°C MEDIUM power.
While the tacos are heating, peel and chop the avocado and toss in lemon juice. Stir into the chicken filling. Fill the tacos with the chicken filling.
